meanings.definition: To have a skill or talent in a particular area.
meanings.sent3: The magician knacked pulling rabbits out of hats.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother knacked storytelling like no other.
meanings.sent5: The chef knacked creating mouth-watering dishes.

meanings.definition: To be tired or worn out.
meanings.sent1: After the long hike, they were knacked and ready for a rest.
meanings.sent2: She felt knacked after a day of cleaning the entire house.
meanings.sent3: The puppy looked knacked after playing in the park all day.
meanings.sent4: The old car was knacked and needed a lot of repairs.
meanings.sent5: The marathon runner was knacked but pushed through to the finish line.
